info.title: Payment Experience Web Profiles
info.description: Use the Payment Experience API to create seamless payment experience profiles. For information about how to create a PayPal payment with a web experience profile, see Web experience profiles.

post.description: Creates a web experience profile. In the JSON request body, specify the profile name and details.

200.description: A successful request, with or without the optional PayPal-Request-Id request header, returns the HTTP 201 Created status code and a JSON response body that shows the profile details and the ID of the profile. Any subsequent calls with the same PayPal-Request-Id request header value within a three-hour window returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows the profile details and the ID of the profile.

201.description: A successful request, with or without the optional PayPal-Request-Id request header, returns the HTTP 201 Created status code and a JSON response body that shows the profile details and the ID of the profile. Any subsequent calls with the same PayPal-Request-Id request header value within a three-hour window returns the HTTP 200 OK status code and a JSON response body that shows the profile details and the ID of the profile.

500.description: An internal server error occurred. The request returns the HTTP `500 Internal Server Error` status code.

get.description: Lists the latest 20 web experience profiles for a merchant or subject. To show details for these or additional profiles, you can show web experience profile details by ID.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that lists the latest 20 profiles that the merchant owns, with details. To show details for these or additional profiles, you can show web experience profile details by ID.

500.description: An internal server error occurred. The request returns the HTTP `500 Internal Server Error` status code.

put.description: Updates a web experience profile, by ID. In the JSON request body, specify the profile details. If your request omits any profile parameters, any previously set values for those parameters are removed.

204.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `204 No Content` status code with no JSON response body.

500.description: An internal server error occurred. The request returns the HTTP `500 Internal Server Error` status code.

patch.description: Partially-updates a web experience profile, by ID. In the JSON request body, specify a patch object, the path of the profile location to update, and a new value.

204.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `204 No Content` status code with no JSON response body.

500.description: An internal server error occurred. The request returns the HTTP `500 Internal Server Error` status code.

get.summary: Show web experience profile details by ID
get.description: Shows details for a web experience profile, by ID.

200.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `200 OK` status code and a JSON response body that shows the profile details.

500.description: An internal server error occurred. The request returns the HTTP `500 Internal Server Error` status code.

delete.description: Deletes a web experience profile, by ID.

204.description: A successful request returns the HTTP `204 No Content` status code with no JSON response body.

500.description: An internal server error occurred. The request returns the HTTP `500 Internal Server Error` status code.

tags.name: web-profiles
tags.description: Use the `/payment-experience/web-profiles` resource to create, show details for, list, update, partially update, and delete web experience profiles.

scopes.https://uri.paypal.com/services/payments: New special privileged scope available for payment and manage payment experience profiles. Available to internal clients only.
Permission to do any real-time payment and manage-payment experience profiles with support for sale, authorize, and order intents.

paypal_request_id.name: PayPal-Request-Id
paypal_request_id.description: The server stores keys for three hours.

content_type.name: Content-Type
content_type.description: Required for operations with a request body. The value is application/<format>. Where the 'format' is 'json'.

id.name: id
id.description: The ID of the profile to delete.

error_details.title: Error Details
error_details.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The field that caused the error. If this field is in the body, set this value to the field's JSON pointer value. Required for client-side errors.

value.description: The value of the field that caused the error.

location.description: The location of the field that caused the error. Value is `body`, `path`, or `query`.

issue.description: The unique, fine-grained application-level error code.

description.description: The human-readable description for an issue. The description can change over the lifetime of an API, so clients must not depend on this value.

enum: Request is not well-formed, syntactically incorrect, or violates schema.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

information_link.description: The information link, or URI, that shows detailed information about this error for the developer.

id.description: The ID of the web experience profile.

name.description: The web experience profile name. Must be unique for a set of profiles for a merchant.

temporary.description: Indicates whether the profile persists for three hours or permanently. To persist the profile permanently, set to `false`. To persist the profile for three hours, set to `true`.

landing_page_type.description: The type of landing page to display on the PayPal site for user checkout. To use the non-PayPal account landing page, set to `Billing`. To use the PayPal account login landing page, set to `Login`.

bank_txn_pending_url.description: The merchant site URL to display after a bank transfer payment. In Germany, valid only for the Giropay payment method or bank transfer payment method.

user_action.description:
Presents either the **Continue** or **Pay Now** checkout flow to the customer.

Default is **Continue**, or `user_action=continue`. When you do not know the final payment amount, accept this default flow, which redirects the customer to the PayPal payment page with the **Continue** button. When the customer clicks **Continue**, the customer can change the payment amount.

When you know the final payment amount, set `user_action=commit` to choose the **Pay Now** flow, which redirects the customer to the PayPal payment page with the **Pay Now** button. When the customer clicks **Pay Now**, the payment is processed immediately.

return_uri_http_method.description: The HTTP method to use to redirect the customer to a return URL. Value is `GET` or `POST`.

no_shipping.description:
Indicates whether PayPal displays shipping address fields on the experience pages. Value is:
  • 0. Displays the shipping address on the PayPal pages.
  • 1. Redacts shipping address fields from the PayPal pages. For digital goods, this field is required and must be 1.
  • 2. Gets the shipping address from the customer's account profile.

address_override.description:
Indicates whether to display the shipping address that is passed to this call rather than the one on file for this buyer on the PayPal experience pages. Value is:
  • 0. Displays the shipping address on file.
  • 1. Displays the shipping address specified in this call. the customer cannot edit this shipping address.

brand_name.description: A label that overrides the business name in the PayPal account on the PayPal pages. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

logo_image.description: A URL to the logo image. A valid media type is `.gif`, `.jpg`, or `.png`. The image's maximum width is 190 pixels and maximum height is 60 pixels. PayPal crops images that are larger. PayPal places your logo image at the top of the cart review area. PayPal recommends that you store the image on a secure (HTTPS) server. Otherwise, web browsers display a message that checkout pages contain non-secure items. Character length and limitations: 127 single-byte alphanumeric characters.

locale_code.description: The locale of pages that the PayPal payment experience displays. A valid value is `AU`, `AT`, `BE`, `BR`, `CA`, `CH`, `CN`, `DE`, `ES`, `GB`, `FR`, `IT`, `NL`, `PL`, `PT`, `RU`, or `US`. A 5-character code is also valid for languages in these countries: `da_DK`, `he_IL`, `id_ID`, `ja_JP`, `no_NO`, `pt_BR`, `ru_RU`, `sv_SE`, `th_TH`, `zh_CN`, `zh_HK`, or `zh_TW`.

error_details-2.title: Error Details
error_details-2.description: The error details. Required for client-side `4XX` errors.

field.description: The name of the field that caused the error.

name.description: The human-readable, unique name of the error.

debug_id.description: The PayPal internal ID. Used for correlation purposes.

message.description: The message that describes the error.

information_link.description: The URI to detailed information related to this error for the developer.

details.description: An array of additional details for the error.

patch.title: Patch
patch.description: The JSON patch object to apply partial updates to resources.

path.description: The JSON Pointer to the target document location at which to complete the operation.

value.title: Patch Value
value.description: The value to apply. The remove operation does not require a value.

from.description: The JSON Pointer to the target document location from which to move the value. Required for the move operation.

patch_request.title: Patch Request
patch_request.description: An array of JSON patch objects to apply partial updates to resources.
